senses.definition: to be useful to somebody or improve their life in some way

senses.definition: the most excellent thing or person

senses.definition: if you buy a pig in a poke, you buy something without seeing it or knowing if it is good enough

examples.x: Buying online can mean buying a pig in a poke.

senses.definition: to sell somebody something/to buy something that has no value or is worth much less than the price paid
past

examples.x: Just drive by. Don't stop.
He hurried by without speaking to me.
Excuse me, I can't get by.
Time goes by so quickly.

senses.definition: used to say that something is saved so that it can be used in the future

examples.x: I've put some money by for college fees.

senses.definition: in order to visit somebody for a short time

examples.x: I'll come by this evening and pick up the books.

senses.definition: before long; soon

examples.x: By and by she met an old man with a beard.

senses.definition: used when you are saying something that is generally, but not completely, true

examples.x: By and large, I enjoyed my time at school.

senses.definition: used for showing how or in what way something is done

examples.x: The house is heated by gas.
May I pay by credit card?
I will contact you by letter.
to travel by boat/bus/car/plane
to travel by air/land/sea
Switch it on by pressing this button.

senses.definition: near somebody/something; at the side of somebody/something; next to somebody/something

examples.x: a house by the river
Can we have the table by the window?
Come and sit by me.

senses.definition: used, usually after a passive verb, to show who or what does, creates or causes something

examples.x: He was knocked down by a bus.
a play by Ibsen
Who's that book by?
I was frightened by the noise.

senses.definition: not later than the time mentioned; before

examples.x: Can you finish the work by five o'clock?
I'll have it done by tomorrow.
By this time next week we'll be in New York.
He ought to have arrived by now/by this time.
By the time (that) this letter reaches you I will have left the country.

senses.definition: used before particular nouns without the, to say that something happens as a result of something

examples.x: They met by chance.
I did it by mistake.
The coroner's verdict was ‘death by misadventure’.

senses.definition: used to show the degree or amount of something

examples.x: The bullet missed him by two inches.
House prices went up by 10%.
It would be better by far (= much better) to…

senses.definition: during something; in a particular situation

examples.x: to travel by day/night
We had to work by candlelight.

senses.definition: from what something shows or says; according to something

examples.x: By my watch it is two o'clock.
I could tell by the look on her face that something terrible had happened.
By law, you are a child until you are 18.

senses.definition: past somebody/something

examples.x: He walked by me without speaking.

senses.definition: used to show the part of somebody/something that somebody touches, holds, etc.

examples.x: I took him by the hand.
She seized her by the hair.
Pick it up by the handle!

senses.definition: used with the to show the period or quantity used for buying, selling or measuring something

examples.x: We rented the car by the day.
They're paid by the hour.
We only sell it by the metre.

senses.definition: used to state the rate at which something happens

examples.x: They're improving day by day.
We'll do it bit by bit.
It was getting worse by the minute (= very fast).
The children came in two by two (= in groups of two).

senses.definition: used to show the measurements of something

examples.x: The room measures fifteen feet by twenty feet.

senses.definition: used when multiplying or dividing

examples.x: 6 multiplied by 2 equals 12.
6 divided by 2 equals 3.

senses.definition: used for giving more information about where somebody comes from, what somebody does, etc.

examples.x: He's German by birth.
They're both doctors by profession.

senses.definition: used when swearing to mean ‘in the name of’

examples.x: I swear by Almighty God…

senses.definition: used to introduce a comment or question that is not directly related to what you have been talking about
goodbye

examples.x: Bye! See you next week.
She waved bye-bye and got into the car.
Bye for now Dad!

senses.definition: general health and happiness

examples.x: emotional/physical/psychological well-being
to have a sense of well-being
We try to ensure the well-being of our employees.
